Class LegacyHttpAssembler

java.lang.Object
ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.protocol.http.legacy.LegacyHttpAssembler
@Deprecated(since="0.1.0", forRemoval=true) public final class LegacyHttpAssembler extends Object
Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
since RADAR 0.1.0; scheduled for removal in RADAR 0.2.0. Use PosterUseCase or the protocol-specific PosterPipeline implementations instead.
Legacy entry point for the retired HTTP assembler pipeline.

This stub throws to guard deployments that still reference the pre-0.1 assembler wiring.

Replace invocations with the modern pipeline, for example:

PosterUseCase poster = new PosterUseCase();
poster.run(posterConfig);

  • Method Details

    • onTcpSegment

      public void onTcpSegment(long timestampMicros, String src, int srcPort, String dst, int dstPort, long sequence, boolean fromClient, byte[] payload, int offset, int length, boolean fin)
      Deprecated.
      since RADAR 0.1.0; invoke the current assemble/poster pipeline instead
      Retained only for binary compatibility; always throws UnsupportedOperationException.
      Parameters:
      timestampMicros - capture timestamp in microseconds
      src - source IP address
      srcPort - source TCP port
      dst - destination IP address
      dstPort - destination TCP port
      sequence - TCP sequence number
      fromClient - true when the segment originated from the client
      payload - TCP payload bytes
      offset - payload offset within the array
      length - number of bytes provided in payload
      fin - whether the FIN flag was set
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - always thrown to signal unsupported usage
